metadata.title: CVE-2020-12656 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description: ** DISPUTED ** gss_mech_free in net/sunrpc/auth_gss/gss_mech_switch.c inthe rpcsec_gss_krb5 implementation in the Linux kernel through 5.6.10 lackscertain domain_release calls, leading to a memory leak. Note: This wasdisputed with the assertion that the issue does not grant any access notalready available. It is a problem that on unloading a specific kernelmodule some memory is leaked, but loading kernel modules is a privilegedoperation. A user could also write a kernel module to consume any amount ofmemory they like and load that replicating the effect of this bug.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
